7-11_jesus.name: 7-11 Jesus
7-11_jesus.biography:
7-11 Jesus is a three piece slurpee rock back from San Francisco. They initially formed after August Darula (Guitar/vocals)  and Kieran Gill (Drums/moral support) fumbled around searching for sacred riff of all rock, in the dimly lit basement of Music City. After nearly a half a year of scattered practices and jam sessions, a band name was found and with that band name came riffs, hi-hat ticks, and bass licks as holy as Jesus himself. 7-11 Jesus was thenceforth birthed in the tumultuous slopes of San Francisco in the year of 2017.  Emma Jacobson (Bass/shoe-tying) solidified the three-piece sonic concoction that is now 7-11 Jesus with her ability - and devotion - to slap-a-dah-bass.
	These three young musicians have gone on to play their first few shows as well as produce their first EP in 2018. Their first EP titled “Oh No” combines both loud and soft moments with angular riffs, hot snare flicks, and a thick stream of steady bass plucks that all help ferment the three piece into one solid stream of sound (uncarbonated). Sonically the album floats between punk rock, garage rock, and psychedelic rock while occupying terrains that have yet to be discovered. Strange riffs, unique drumming, and pulverizing bass lines push 7-11 Jesus in a direction that is their own - it’s up to the listener to determine whether or not that is a good or bad direction. 
	 As their yearning for the tastiest riffs, jams, and slaps continues to devour their musical devotion 7-11 Jesus is on the cusp of releasing another EP/LP within 2018. As they begin to blend their influences together to create an even tastier concoction (or Slurpee) than their past EP, they find themselves writing more ambitious songs that will surely result in head-banging, crying, and possibly neither (or both) of those outcomes.

the_rift.name: The Rift
the_rift.biography:
The Rift is an experimental rock band from Bowling Green, KY, which consists of four sweet boys who are just trying to do their best. 
These sweet boys are: 
Kai Rogers, Guitar/Vocals
Spencer Woods, Piano/Vocals
Colton Turley, Bass
Yan Garza, Drums

lost_henry.name: Lost Henry
lost_henry.biography: Lost Henry is a 5 piece pop punk/emo band from Highland Heights, KY. They met at Northern Kentucky University, building an audience there before breaking into their local scene. The band is currently finishing their debut EP with producer Eric Tuffendsam (The Wonder Years, Close To Home, Harbour) at Moonlight Studios in Fairfield, Ohio. Their first two singles, “Misfit” and “Thanks For Coming” are available on all streaming services now!

milk.name: Milk
milk.biography: Milk is a San Francisco garage rock band. Milk started when Kat (guitar) and Lucya (drums) replied to an ad on craigslist that Johnny (bass, vocals) put up. Kat brought in her guitarist friend from college, Olivia. During their time together they released Another Great Smell in the City, played several colleges, and opened for T-Pain. Many have refered to their music as "90's cartoons for your ears."

another_great_smell_in_the_city.name: Another Great Smell in the City
